After a year as an associate professor in the Department of applied statistics at Agrocampus Ouest in France, she pursued her research on high-throughput molecular data integration in metabolic diseases at the University of California, Los Angeles. In 2015, she joined the "Cartes d'Identit√© des Tumeurs" research team in Paris before being recruited as a research scientist at the CNRS in 2020. She has been leading projects in cancer genomics for several years and is involved in methodological developments for a better understanding of intra-tumor heterogeneity.
